title: Accessibility problems
description: When launching the Help view, I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas (e.g. the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame) before the tab key starts working. This issue is observed on Win2K.
OB: When the Help view is launched on Win2K, the tab key does not have any functionality until I click on one of the 'live' areas (banner, nav frame, or content frame).
EB: The tab key should function properly without requiring any initial click in the 'live' areas. The tab key should be usable as soon as the Help view is launched on Win2K.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Launch the Help view on Win2K. 2. Try using the tab key to navigate and interact with the elements within the Help view. Observe that the tab key does not work until you click on one of the 'live' areas (banner, nav frame, or content frame).
